Dear Kari Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Claudia Tristram.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Staff sufficiency.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4131 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required.
Description (1) The licensee shall develop and implement a written plan to
assure compliance with the child protection law, 1975 PA 238,
MCL 722.621 to 722.638.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Several staff did not report suspected child abuse and neglect as
required by the child protection law.
Investigation On 5/15/23 Facility Manager C reported to Director T that the
female youth were reporting inappropriate sexual communication
and touch by Supervisor R. Director T reported the information to
CI and PREA on 5/17/23.
Supervisor B reported one day when he came on the Pod Youth A
said Supervisor R "I don't like that pervert". Youth A told him about
Supervisor R talking about his penis as a monster. Supervisor B
reported it was difficult to tell if Youth A was joking but he reported
it a couple days later as he was off after hearing about it.
Case Manager P was told by the girls and failed to report to CI.
Security Supervisor B was told by the girls and failed to report to
CI.
Youth Worker M was told by the girls and failed to report to CI.
Facility Manager C was told by the girls and failed to report to CI.
Analysis There is evidence to support that several staff failed to report
suspected child abuse and neglect. Some staff reported the
information to their direct supervisors but are also mandated
reporters and must report to CI immediately.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2022C0207002 with approved CAP
2022C0207010 with approved CAP

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
